alert.note: Alert for Lampasas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 10:31AM CDT until May 05 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Bell, Coryell and Lampasas Counties. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Killeen, Copperas Cove, Harker Heights, Gatesville, McGregor, Fort Hood, Nolanville, Kempner, Fort Gates, Mother Neff State Park, Oglesby and South Mountain.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Normally dry washes will fill with swift moving water, avoid these areas.
